Description: Terracotta figurine mould in Nile clay; impression of a standing Bes, shown frontal view; wearing his characteristic feathered crown; lower part missing, broken at feet level of Bes; probably locally made; in reddish brown micaceous Nile silt fabric.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Possibly used for Ptolemaic mould-made pottery- (Bailey 2008, 3645, 3646).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DG.12) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5885 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
